page.title: 16British Sugar Corporation
page.content: Peterborough is the headquarters of {British Sugar}- one of Europe's biggest sugar producers. Each year, the company makes more than one million tonnes of Silver Spoon sugar - approximately half the total UK demand - at its thirteen factories, eleven of which are located in Eastern England. British Sugar's links with the city go back to 1926 with the opening of the Peterborough sugar factory. In the mid-1970's, head office operations were transferred from London to a purpose built office complex in Oundle Road - the nerve centre of a nationwide operation with annual turnover in excess of Â£600 million. The raw material, sugar beet, is grown by about 12,000 British farmers and Peterborough factory handles the crop from more than 1,000 growers operating within a 25 mile area around the city.
